name: Baldauf, Hans Rainer
title: Founding Principal
ngos: Maybeck Foundation (Chairman); Center for Urban Education about Sustainable Agriculture / CUESA (Board President 2013-2015)
notes: FAIA LEED AP; Yale BA 1981 and MArch 1988; co-founded BCV in 1997; led design of San Francisco Ferry Building Marketplace 1999

name: Bea, Carlos Tiburcio
employer: United States Court of Appeals for the Ninth Circuit
title: Senior Circuit Judge
notes: Born San Sebastian, Spain 1934; naturalized U.S. citizen 1959; Stanford BA 1956, Stanford Law JD 1958; private practice in San Francisco 1959-1990; San Francisco County Superior Court Judge 1990-2003; nominated to 9th Circuit by President George W. Bush, confirmed 86-0 in 2003; assumed senior status December 2019; taught at Hastings College of Law and Stanford Law School; former member Cuba 1952 Olympic team

name: Bertero, Craige
title: Partner
notes: Series 63 and Series 65 licensed; based in San Francisco, CA; UC Berkeley Haas School of Business MBA 1993-1995; 27+ years in financial services

name: Drysdale, George M.
title: Chairman and CEO
political_donations: $41,100 to Trump re-election campaign (2019/2020 cycle) per FEC records
ngos: Harvey Mudd College, Trustee; Marsman Drysdale Foundation; National Advisory Council Small Business (Executive Director, 1991)
notes: Born Manila September 16, 1954; Harvey Mudd College BS Engineering 1976; Stanford JD and MBA 1980; Hambrecht & Quist Venture Partners GP 1983-1987; White House Fellow 1987, Special Assistant to Secretary of Agriculture Richard Lyng; minority investor in San Francisco Giants since 1994; splits time between Manila and Hillsborough CA

name: Hartman, Daniel F.
employer: San Francisco Ear, Nose and Throat Medical Group
title: Otolaryngologist / Head and Neck Surgeon
notes: MD from UC Irvine School of Medicine 1982; residency at Stanford Medical Center; former Assistant Clinical Professor at UCSF 1987-2004; Fellow of American College of Surgeons and American Academy of Otolaryngology/Head and Neck Surgery; recipient of Francis Sooy Annual Teaching Award from UCSF

name: Hutchinson, Claude Burton Jr.
notes: Harvard Business School graduate; senior executive at Security Pacific Corp; founder and CEO of Civic Bancorp (Oakland), built to $408M in assets before departure; former President of California Bankers Association; ran as Republican congressional candidate in California's 10th District in 2000 primary

name: Jensen, Harbo P.
title: Chief Scientist
ngos: MIT Alumni Association (President, 2007-2008); MIT Corporation (member 1999-2004; ex officio member as alumni president); US Arab Chamber of Commerce (Pacific) (president, director, executive committee member)
notes: Northeastern University BA Chemistry 1971; MIT PhD Chemistry 1974; career at Chevron including VP at ChevronTexaco Global Technologies Services; held roles as Manager Market Evaluation at Chevron International Oil Co. and Manager Caltex Operations and Asia-Pacific; MIT Bronze Beaver Award 1994; Harold E. Lobdell Distinguished Service Award 1986

name: Kostic, Thomas F.
title: Senior Counsel (retired)
notes: UC Berkeley BS 1960 and JD 1964; California CPA 1964-2004; licensed attorney since 1965; tax and estate planning specialist; selected to Super Lawyers 2004-2012; resides in Mill Valley, CA; born November 9, 1937

name: Link, Thomas Hamilton
notes: California State Bar attorney license #112560; admitted December 12, 1983; George Washington University Law School; primary practice area criminal law; resides in Valley Village, CA

name: Madding, Bruce W.
title: Vice Chairman
ngos: UC Berkeley Foundation Investment Committee (member); American Red Cross Investment Committee (former chair); M Fund Inc. (board member)
notes: San Francisco native; USC MBA; CPA; 22 years at Henry J. Kaiser Family Foundation as SVP and CFO/CIO; joined C.M. Capital Corporation as President and CEO in 2010; 2010 Lifetime Achievement Award from Foundation and Endowment Money Management; former lecturer at Stanford Business School

name: Markison, Robert E.
title: Clinical Professor of Surgery; Private Practice Hand Surgeon
notes: Columbia University BA; Dartmouth Medical School MD; UCSF surgery residency; hand surgery fellowship under Dr. Kilgore and Dr. Newmeyer at UCSF; microsurgical training at Buncke Clinic; Chief of Hand Surgery and Trauma Team Surgeon at SF General Hospital 1981-1989; Faculty Member of San Francisco Orthopedic Residency Program; Lifetime Member of American Society for Surgery of the Hand; also a performing musician, artist, and instrument maker

name: Pendergast, Gene E. Jr.
title: Of Counsel
notes: UC Davis BA political science; UC Berkeley School of Law JD 1964; bar admitted 1965; private practice since 1965, Of Counsel at Wilke Fleury since 2000; specializes in estate planning, probate, and real estate; Sacramento; selected to Super Lawyers 2004-2007; longtime philanthropist supporting UC Davis; recipient of Soderquist Award from UC Davis

name: Wangeman, Conrad
title: Chief Executive Officer
notes: Cornell University School of Hotel Administration graduate; 23+ years with Hilton Hotels Corp in roles from food and beverage director to GM to Area VP Operations Northeast; GM of Hilton San Francisco Airport, Hilton Pittsburgh, and Hilton New York; Area Vice President Operations Northeast for Hilton Worldwide; received General Manager of the Year awards from New York Concierge Association and HSMAI

name: Watkins, Richardson L. Watkins, T
title: Partner
ngos: Urban Land Institute (Member); NAIOP Silicon Valley (Member); City of Hope Real Estate Council (former Board President, Northern California)
notes: Amherst College graduate; Stanford GSB MBA; 35+ years commercial real estate experience; with TMG Partners since 1994; previously ran Northern California operations for national real estate development company; directed 48-story mixed-use project in downtown San Francisco; acquisitions officer for SF-based investment advisory firm

name: Watts, H. David
title: Retired Chairman of the Board
ngos: National Academy of Construction (Emeritus Member, inducted 2002)
notes: Born 1938; Cornell University BA economics 1960; U.S. Navy lieutenant leading underwater demolition teams; President and CEO of Ford, Bacon & Davis 1984-1987; over 35 years at Granite Construction helping triple company volume and make it a leading public corporation; Golden Beaver Award in Management; Outstanding Achievement Award from The Moles; Contractor Achievement Award from AGC of California
